sessions.title: Go to Your Session
Designing for Creators: UX Strategies for Complex Softwares
sessions.description:
Creative tools—like game engines and professional software—are often designed for power users who need flexibility and control. Too frequently, these tools assume that complexity must mean difficulty, with UX as an afterthought. This results in steep learning curves, overwhelming interfaces, and inefficient workflows.

In this talk, I will explore how UX strategies can redefine what’s possible in creative software by making complexity feel intuitive without sacrificing depth. We’ll cover key concepts like defining user profiles, prioritizing workflows, and introducing complexity only when necessary, enabling diverse creators of all technical skill levels to participate, experiment, and innovate.

sessions.title: AI meets Web Development: Build your portfolio in 30min with Cursor
sessions.description:
If you’ve used GitHub Copilot or ChatGPT to write code, you’re already familiar with the power of AI in coding. But Cursor takes it a step further, making it even easier to create anything you want—quickly and efficiently.

In this talk, I’ll show you what Cursor is and how simple it is to use it to write code and bring your ideas to life. Whether you’re looking to learn a new technology or create your portfolio, Cursor’s AI-powered code editor not only writes the code for you, but also explains it in real-time, making learning and creation smoother than ever. Join me as we build a portfolio together in just 30 minutes using Cursor, and discover how AI can help you unlock new possibilities in your development journey.

sessions.title: Humanizing AI: Empowering users through transparent design
sessions.description:
Join me as I explore the five essential pillars of designing for AI—principles inspired by the nuanced challenges of healthcare product design. Together, we’ll unpack how to create personalized, accessible, and trustworthy user experiences that empower diverse audiences while fostering inclusivity and transparency. Whether you’re an experienced designer, collaborating with a design team or just starting out, this talk will equip you with actionable strategies to humanize AI and make a meaningful impact on the future of design.

Designed to be inspirational and actionable, this talk will cover: Parallels between designing for AI and designing for healthcare... Real-world examples, like integrating AI into a virtual fertility clinic application or designing a GenAI system to simplify international processes...

sessions.title: The UX-AI Evolution: Redefining Interaction & Design
sessions.description: AI is revolutionizing UX design, enabling experiences that are more personalized, predictive, and adaptive. But with great power comes responsibility—how do we ensure AI enhances human experiences without compromising ethics? This talk delves into key AI-driven UX trends, such as generative design, AI-powered UX research, automation in prototyping, and bias mitigation. We’ll explore how emerging AI tools are reshaping user interaction patterns, reimagining accessibility, and shifting the role of designers towards AI-human collaboration. Attendees will leave with a clearer vision of AI’s impact on UX, practical strategies for ethical AI integration, and insights into future-proofing UX careers in an AI-first world.
sessions.shortDescription: AI is revolutionizing UX design, enabling experiences that are more personalized, predictive, and adaptive. But with great power comes responsibility—how do we ensure AI enhances human experiences without compromising ethics?

sessions.title: Redefining Cinema: Bringing a Web3 Film Festival and AI Discussions to Montreal
sessions.description:
The intersection of technology and cinema has unlocked revolutionary possibilities, from AI-driven storytelling to decentralized Web3 funding models. As the founder of Las Flores Web3 Film Festival, I navigated cultural, gender, and financial barriers to bring this groundbreaking festival to life in Montreal. My talk will delve into:
Overcoming Adversity: My journey as a Mexican woman leading innovation in a male-dominated industry.
Redefining Cinema: How Web3 and AI are transforming film creation, funding, and distribution.
Building Value-Based Tech Initiatives: Insights from developing a program to fund Web3-AI film projects.
Empowering Women in Tech: Lessons on resilience, leadership, and creating impact in the tech and creative industries.
By redefining what’s possible, Las Flores has become a catalyst for collaboration, innovation, and diversity in the cinematic arts. Attendees will leave inspired to harness technology to break barriers, champion inclusivity, and shape the future of storytelling.

As the founder of Las Flores Web3 Film Festival, I navigated cultural, gender, and financial barriers to bring this groundbreaking festival to life in Montreal.

sessions.title: Myths and Realities of Digital Nomadism: Beyond the Perfect Instagram Photos
sessions.description:
In this talk, I’ll reveal what it’s really like to be a digital nomad—beyond the dreamy Instagram shots working by a pool or on a tropical beach. Some say the hardest part is being away from loved ones or constantly adapting to new cultures, but in my experience, the real challenge is something much simpler: figuring out where to do the laundry with the few clothes we carry in our small luggage.

I’ll share insights on safe travel destinations, what digital nomads actually pack, recommendations and tips if you work in the tech industry, and the true cost of living on the road. Spoiler: It’s not as expensive as you might think. Being a digital nomad isn’t for everyone, and it may not be forever, but it’s a unique lifestyle that lets you explore beautiful places, meet fascinating people, and—most importantly—discover yourself.

sessions.title: Learning Through Experience
sessions.description:
My hypothesis: You can start, even with 0% qualification and learn through experience: an encouragement to get started, regardless of your initial skill level. To undertake, to start a collective enterprise or an NPO, you have no choice but to have this character trait!
How to “survive” experiential learning? 
- Manage your stress (Stress factors) This method can generate more stress, but tools help to manage it 
- Manage each situation at once: Find help as soon as a blockage occurs 
- Abandon the cult of perfection: accept that “good enough” is enough and that each iteration improves results 
- Redefine perfection: create/invent a work environment aligned with your values and your well-being. 
Conclusion: It’s your turn! 
- Call to action: “Start where you are, with what you have.”

sessions.title: Organizations supporting women in Montréal: bridging gaps, breaking barriers together
sessions.description: This panel showcases the leading organizations dedicated to supporting women in Montréal's tech industry. We're united by a common goal: ensuring women have the knowledge and resources they need to thrive and shape their futures in tech, on par with their male counterparts.  Montréal boasts a vibrant ecosystem of organizations working towards this vision, and this panel celebrates that diversity. While each organization maintains its unique identity and approach, we recognize the power of collaboration. Together, we amplify our impact and send a clear message: we are committed to working together to welcome and empower more women and other minorities in the tech sector.

sessions.title: Bias in the Machine: Can AI Ever Be Fair?
sessions.description: As AI systems become increasingly embedded in critical decision-making processes, concerns about fairness and bias have taken center stage. This workshop explores how biases can emerge and propagate throughout the machine learning development lifecycle, from data collection to model deployment, leading to real-world harms. We will begin by unpacking different definitions of fairness, highlighting the complexities of translating social definitions into mathematical formulations. Through hands-on exercises inspired by real-world applications, participants will grapple with the challenges of defining fairness in binary decision-making scenarios. These exercises will illustrate the socio-technical nature of fairness, emphasizing that technical interventions alone cannot resolve systemic biases. Furthermore, we will examine how bias is embedded in the ML pipeline, affecting outcomes in subtle yet impactful ways. Expanding beyond traditional fairness metrics, we will also explore generative AI’s unique fairness challenges, from representation biases to content generation disparities. By the end of this workshop, participants will gain a deeper understanding of fairness as a multidimensional problem and leave with practical insights into developing more responsible AI systems.
